answers.answer: I can't speak for everyone as all have different symtoms but for me those symtoms are what led me to the doctor in the first place. I am not diabetic, but was diagnosed hcv positive in may, genotype 1a.

According to my Hepa...fatigue(sometimes debilitating and often uneplained) is the number one symptom that he hears about and that very often leads to diagnosis. It was what led to my own diagnosis 11 years ago.Ithching is also a documented symptom of any liver related problem  alongf with joint and muscle pain in some.BestWill
Just to clarify ..what he said was that the symptoms mentioned above are not necessarily from related liver damage...but the virus itself

I have Hepc and diabetes II also.  I think your worse symptoms are from poorly controlled diabetes.  I have noticed that salt and sugar make the dry skin worse and thus the itching.  I have noticed that when I let my diet go I have times of such severe fatigue that I go right back to bed in the morning.  That goes away if I control my diet and take my meds.  I take Metformin and Victoza (which I think is a miracle drug).  Metformin, by the way, I just found out, has beneficial effects for the liver.  It tends to retard HCV replication.  Good luck to you.  I remember when my diabetes was first diagnosed I could barely function and had to prop my eyes open with diet pop all the time.
One of many articles on HCV and itchinghttp://www.hepcchallenge.org/pdf/itchyme_reformat1006.pdf

question: Is it normal to have itching,fatigue,irritablility,insomina,pain always at a 5,anxiety.I was diagnosed in July with hepc and diabetes and the symptoms get worse by day.Haven't seen Dr. yet till tuesday to talk treament.
